alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 25 at 7:34PM CDT until April 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL JIM HOGG COUNTY... At 734 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of South Fork Estates, or 11 miles south of Hebbronville, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Jim Hogg County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
